Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mjwrome
Reviews.Content: lovely small hotel. wonderful, kind people at the desk, very welcoming. the room was large, very pretty and bathroom was large as well. It is a bit further afield than some of the hotels in Sultanahmet but that shouldn't put you off. The breakfast room, like many hotels in that area, is in the basement but here they have put sky lights to bring in natural lighting which is great. Cute tables and chairs and a wonderful, vast selection of foods to choose from. Price is very good and we look forward to staying here again. The windows have double pane glass and it was silent, silent, silent. lovely to sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and friendly staffed hotel near all the mayor tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: matychan
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff combined with a decent and interesting breakfast is only part of the charm. Centrally placed and with nice, clean rooms is the rest. Very thin walls and a lack of interesting views are really the only gripes - and they are minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: traintraveller07
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night between flights to try a new Sultanahmet area hotel. The price was very attractive and so is the property, clean and well run. A very good value; like some other area hotels a discount was offered for up front in cash payment which we did. Location is good, a bit away from main Sultanahmet area towards the Little Aya Sofya mosque but a short walk to the Hippodrome and on to the tramway. Room was a good size as was the bathroom, everything worked. Double glazed windows, quiet. Typically steep sided bath shower entry. Breakfast on a sub level is in an attractive room with skylights, and breakfast options were ample, both hot and cold. Staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely would return. Alas there are no great views, but it is instead a very economic and pleasant choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary customer service at Sultan's Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ectomorfo
Reviews.Content: The Sultan's Royal Hotel, where I stayed for 7 nights in April 2012, is situated in a quiet street in the heart of Sultanahmet, within a few minutes' walk of numerous restaurants and, in order of proximity, the Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Cistern and Topkapi Palace. My single room there was of a decent size, quiet and comfortable, with a good firm bed and en-suite bathroom. It was kept clean at all times by the hotel's friendly but inconspicuous cleaning staff and contained a TV, safe deposit box, mini-bar and coffee and tea-making facilities. The free wifi was both entirely reliable and fast. A buffet breakfast with a good selection of a few hot and many cold options was served downstairs in an attractive breakfast room. However, what really makes this hotel is its exceptional customer service. Right from the outset, when I received a warm welcome, cup of tea and informative orientation chat on arrival, nothing was too much trouble for Ersin on the reception desk. Every morning, he was full of suggestions of places to visit, good locations for photography and photographic tips. Throughout my stay at the Sultan's Royal Hotel, I had the impression that all of the other guests staying there were very satisfied with the hotel. It is, therefore, without hesitation that I would recommend the Sultan's Royal Hotel. Not a negative but perhaps worth pointing out: the free airport transfer only applies if you book directly with the hotel and not through a 3rd-party website such as Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: akmar112
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in April 2012 and the first thing that attracted our attention was how clean and well maintained everything was. Location is excellent within a 5-minute walk from all the major sights in Sutanahmet and yet in a quiet street. We got two adjoining rooms and used a door sealing them off from the rest of the rooms which was quite convenient. Breakfast was decent without the frills (with a very nice breakfast room). Size of rooms small but I guess this is how all Sultanahmet hotels are. Service was prompt and courteous and everyone tries to help you out and give you tips. Free Wi-Fi worked very well in the rooms and the hotel in general. Check-in and Check-out fast and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: dugan6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my Fiance in March for four days and it was a great experience! A complimentary shuttle picked us up from the Airport when we arrived which is always nice after a flight plus breakfast was complimentary as well. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted and taken straight to our room that was perfect and very clean! Above all the service was fantastic!! On our way out to try and find a recommended restaurant one night Ersin Cicek (our new friend) at the front desk offered to call the restaurant we were going to because we were going to be late and he even wrote the directions down for us in Turkish so the taxi driver would know exactly where to take us!! This was the best thing that ever could have happened for us because that restaurant happened to be in an area that we went back to several times. Learning some Turkish for our next trip to Istanbul will be helpful but thanks to Ersin we made our way around very easily!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacey C
Reviews.Content: An amazing find - comfortable, modern rooms were quite clean and huge and we had a great view. Room servcie was great - had an amazing time very good price . The neighborhood quiet. Everyone was friendly. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "home feel" hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Irina E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sultans Royal for a week earlier in March this year. It was a family trip to celebrate my dad`s 70-s birthday, first time in Istanbul for all of us and staying at Sultans Royal became one of the best experiences & great memories from this trip. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, â€œhome feelâ€� kind of place to stay with a great value for the money â€“ this hotel is a perfect choice. We chose it mostly based on the traveler`s reviews & couldnâ€™t have been happier, it ticked absolutely all boxes for us. Easy to use website/ reservation system with a very personalized & proper follow-up from the hotel (we booked directly on their website), airport transfer (free from Ataturk Airport) was there on time to pick us up at 5:00am on Sunday, the hotel is very new (complete renovation less than a year ago) so rooms even if on a smaller side were very clean, comfortable and had everything necessary, quiet neighborhood, really nice daily breakfast buffet and fantastic location â€“ 8-10 min walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia & tram as well as many good restaurants & coffee shops. And I have to say that for us the biggest gem of the hotel was definitely its staff, all the lovely people working there that made us feel so welcomed, almost like we were staying at home with family & friends. The most attentive & friendly people ever, you made our trip to this beautiful city even more special, and your hotel totally deserves all the great reviews given here on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff Joan Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Joan G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It is a great location as it is within easy walking distance of all the historical sites but is on a quieter street. We had a room on the 3rd floor which had its own outdoor terrace with a table and chairs. The room was a good size,modern,clean with all the standard amenities. The breakfast provided was good and had lots of variety. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. On our 1st day Ahmed gave us an orientation of the city which was very useful. My only confusion now after reading other reviews is that we were not offered a free transfer from airport but paid for both ways so I would clarify this. Definitely would recommend Sultans Royal Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for quite a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ukrainian_guy
Reviews.Content: Been there in March 2012. Rooms are not very spacious, but very clean and have all necessary amenities. Bathroom is convenient (no problems with the shower). There is no heating (except air-conditioning), so there is a choice between fresh air and comfortable temperature. Location is perfect for Old City, but is quite far from main entertainment area (Taksim), though tram stop is within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Most of the personnel is very helpful and would help you whatever you need. All personnel is English-speaking. Breakfast is ok. Wifi is free and speed is very good. If you pay in cash you will get 7% discount, also there is a free transfer from the airport if you stay for 3 nights or more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent receptionist and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: j1990ns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2nights. It was a little difficult to find but location was good. Receptionists was friendly and gave us much information for sightseeing. Thanks to them, We really enjoyed Istanbul efficiently. Breakfast was delicious and included a variety of foods. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Recently remodeled. Excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: The Sultans Royal is located in walking distance to the Blue Mosque and other points of interest. Many excellent restaurants are located nearby. There is a taxi stand approximately 100 feet from the hotel, though the taxi drivers were certainly the worst part of Istanbul. The tram station is also close and only about an 8 minute walk away. The hotel was very clean and was recently remodeled. The rooms are an adequate size and larger than many other rooms found in Europe and Asia. I am not sure how the views are from other rooms but our view was the back of an old building. Free breakfast was provided downstairs every morning. The customer service is outstanding. All personnel at the front desk went out of their way to assist us with everything we needed. In particular, Ersin was extremely friendly and an excellent source of information. We have added a picture of him at the front desk of the lobby. The hotel provided a free hotel transfer from the airport and would have provided a round trip transfer if we had stayed for 7 days. We thought it was an excellent value at $88/night considering the location, quality, customer service, and complimentary airport transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - the best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: darkr00m
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful few days in the mesmerising city of Istanbul. Having stayed in the city before, I was not expecting too much from the accommodation - the price and location seemed too good to be true. I can honestly say I have never been so warmly welcomed, the staff alone are reason enough to stay here. So friendly, genuine, knowledgeable and helpful - especially Ersin. The situation could not have been better - about 5 minutes walk to the Blue mosque, 10 to the Cistern and not much more to the Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. The rooms are comfortable, clean and prettily decorated. Breakfast was superb. We were picked up at the airport on arrival without a hitch as part of the rate and there was a discount for paying in cash. I couldn't believe what value we got for our money. I will certainly be back and would highly recommend the Sultans Royal to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Blew away my expectations!! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JesslovesTravel2
Reviews.Content: Looking for a wonderful small hotel with an amazing staff? Look no further. This is a European style hotel, but nicer than I expected. Quality linens, comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom. Ehmet (sp?) at front desk was a complete pleasure, helping us make the most of our very short time in Istanbul. He even arranged sandwiches to be made to take on our early flight sincbe will be missing breakfast. Location is wonderful. About 5 minute walk to Blue Mosque and just a 15 minute walk beyond that to the grand Bazaar. If you don't like to walk, there is a tram near the Blue Mosque. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: mcquinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in March 2012. Hotel is centrally located and only few minutes away from main city attractions. Restaurants, bars and souvenir shops are near as well. The rooms are equipped with safe, mini bar, hair dryer, A/C and TV and very, very clean. Staff was helpful and informed, and made our stay pleasant. Discount for cash payment and free airport transfer should be mentioned as well. Definitely would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Sultans Royal Hotel excellent staff and a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Adi T
Reviews.Content: We spend there five nights at Sultans Royal Hotel.Their services were at high standards and the location was neat Blue Mosque, Aya Sophya and many others places from Istanbul.The breakfast was very good and the rooms were clean and it was newly remodeled.We recomanded this hotel because it was really nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: GÃ¼lnaz B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in february 2012. Perfectly located within 2 minute walk of Blue mosque in a quiet street. Hotel was really nice and clean. Excellent staff, very helpfull. Will definitely go back for another stay. Simply great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MKloberdanz
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was so nice and welcoming. They gave great recommendations and were extremely helpful with planning day trips and transportation. Perfect location and proximity to all of the main attractions, while still being nice and quiet at the same time. The rooms were small, but always clean and very comfortable. I'd recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JRufian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and it has fast access to main roads. Guys at the reception are the very best in the profession !!! Higly recommended and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AAhmad2007
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 1 young child) stayed in Sultans Royal Hotel in February 2012. I have to say that I was extremely happy with my choice. All the staff was helpful and the service was really good. Hotel location is good for visiting sites. We were offered help in planning our days and shopping. I'm sure I would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in excellent location. Hotel facilities are good and the staff are exceptional in working very hard to welcome and look after their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: peewam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Istanbul. This is a very good hotel, walking distance to the major sites and also to the trams for exploring further afield. The hotel was exceptionally good value. Everywhere was clean and fresh, the buffet breakfast was good and there was also free wifi. Our room was comfortable and big enough for the two of us. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful - a level of personal service that you don't get at the big chains. We booked a transfer to and from the airport and all went to plan. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel if you want a comfortable good value stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lovely and Friendy Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at this hotel in December our first visit to Istanbul it is a beautiful City. We were very impressed by this hotel the location was perfect and the staff were very friendly and professional, our rooms were nice and clean and the food was very nice an open buffet so always something there we liked. The Hotel also offer to book sight seeing tours etc which was a great help to us Ersin who works at reception told us the best places to visit and we had a great time! i would recommend this Hotel to everyone we will definatley be back again.

Reviews.Title: “sultanahmmet refuge”
Reviews.Author: Syoui
Reviews.Content: Our week-long stay was for business, so the Sultans Royal Hotel was a fine refuge at the end of the work day. The price was very affordable, the amenities were basic and the English-speaking staff was exceptional in pointing us in the right direction. The receptionists made every effort to find us the businesses we required and the transportation to get us there. In many cases, we were able to walk wherever we needed to, since the location of the hotel is so central to our needs. The tourist attractions and the bazaar are all within reasonable walking distance of the Sultans Royal, but if a taxi was needed, one would arrive within 2 minutes of being requested. Airport transfers both to and from were provided by the hotel, since we were there for 7 nights. There are numerous restaurants just near the hotel, although we only went to one very cozy Turkish-style place several consecutive nights because the ambience was so appealing. The breakfast at the hotel was adequate, but we felt they could have varied their choices for the benefit of those who have to stay a full week. There is no place to sit and have a chat or a drink in the hotel, so you are going there only to sleep, eat and shower, but for us the needs were adequately met. I would say that the staff are the biggest thing going for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite”
Reviews.Author: simon s
Reviews.Content: i have been 5 times to istanbul in deferent hotels.but sultans royal hotel was one of the best choices. calm,clean,sleep quality was excellent,good service Ä±f you go to sultan royal hotel please ask for ersin ,just sit front of his desk and order whatever you wanna drink then ask him any question .he will answer you and he will give you the map of istanbul and show you the directÄ±on as well for any place you wanna go . the hotel just was perfect

Reviews.Title: “the best value and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: seanhsu
Reviews.Content: æˆ‘æƒ³é€™æ˜¯ç‰©è¶…æ‰€å€¼çš„é£¯åº—, åœ¨æ«ƒæª¯ä½¿ç”¨,é™¤äº†tripadvisroæ��ä¾›çš„å„ªæƒ å¤–,ç�¾é‡‘ä»˜æ¬¾å�¯äº«8%ç�¾é‡‘æŠ˜æ‰£ ä¸»è¦�hotelæ„Ÿè¦ºéƒ½æ»¿æ–°çš„,æ«ƒå�°ä¹Ÿéƒ½å¾ˆè¦ªåˆ‡,ç¬‘è‡‰è¿Žäºº,ä¹‹å¾Œæ�¬åˆ°ä½�çš„Taksimé™„è¿‘çš„lush hotel,æ„Ÿè¦ºå°±å·®äº†å¾ˆå¤š It was very worthy and best value hotel I experienced ever

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Eirini_Sv
Reviews.Content: Even we were strongly recommended to stay to Taxim, we don't regret choosing Sultanahmet and especially Sultans Royal Hotel. A great hotel with very good service providing any necessary info for Istanbul. Clean rooms, variety in breakfast, friendly staff, peaceful location very close to monuments. Unforgetable experience. Next time to Istanbul, definately to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Irma N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We got the family suite (2 rooms at the corner) and was really pleased with it. Being winter and some bad weather, we had to plan our day to make the most of our trip. The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful. They helped us plan according to the weather forecast. They recommended us good restaurants to go to and where to get stuff, etc. The hotel is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Underground cistern, Grand Bazaar, etc. There are good and affordable restaurants nearby. Just ask them. Free wifi troughout the hotel. Free breakfast and free transportation to and from the airport was included in our package. We've been travelling a lot the past to years (Australia, New Zealand, US, Italy and France) and I must say, this was very impressive. We normally stay at the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic location and extremely helpfull staff !!"”
Reviews.Author: ilham B
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and we were very sad to leave at the end of our stay :( The hotel is nice, clean and safe. It's also ideal for visiting all the major attractions and for getting to the tram to explore further afield. However it was the staff who made our stay so memorable. They were extremely helpful especially Erdal, manager at the reception, a lovely person who spoke fluent English and would go out of his way to help! I think we could not have chosen a better place to stay. We would thoroughly recommend "Sultans Royal Hotel" to anyone visiting Istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Fab Holiday!!!Amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jurgita G
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel with my husband on November and we have seen very good service from all staff,the rooms are very clean and hotel is very new style.And the hotel located centre of old city to go Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia,TopkapÄ± Palace etc.just 5-10 minutes by walking distance.We want to thank you for all staff for their assistance and especially Mr.Ersin who always helped us for our Istanbul tours and recommended us for good restaurant.He is very friendly and hospitable person. We must not forget to mention the breakfast.Of all the hotels we stayed in Turkey,this one had by far the best breakfast buffet.It was both traditional, contemporary,and most of all,complete. We highly recommend this hotel.I enjoyed Istanbul so much more because of their quality and service Thank you Mr.Ersin !!!!!! We come back later...:) ..

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Edoardo F
Reviews.Content: A charming boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul. Great location, in a small quiet street very close to Blue Mosquee. At the end of the street, there is a taxi station and near the Blue Mosquee there is a tram station where you can take a tram to Taksim square. The hotel is very clean, staff is absolutely friendly and they can help you to find best solutions for your visit. We stayed there from 30th of December 2011 to 4th of January 2012 and it was a great stay. So, Sultans Royal Hotel is absolutely reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOHAMED293807
Reviews.Content: we really enjoy in hotel , but the staff was really helpful when ever we are going out to vist a place or to shopping, it is very clean and comforttabl,and they give us good impression of ISTANBUL.

Reviews.Title: “a real pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ALTARIQ
Reviews.Content: first of all this hotel was satisfied my Requirements for this Reasons 1- very good location , a steps walk from the best places in Istanbul 2- the staff was really helpful when ever we are going out they ask us if we need help and they really mean it , they give us many suggestions for restaurants and tours . 3- the room was clean and comfortable 4- the price was very good if we compare it to the other hotels. when ever i will go to Istanbul for sure i'll stay in sultans royal hotel coz i don't need a fancy lobby and a big bill this hotel have all the things i really need

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Natasha M
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Istanbul for the first time and felt completely comfortable and at home at the Sultans Royal Hotel. The staff were very helpful and offered us directions and suggestions for restaurants and tours. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful. We mentioned that we were in Istanbul for my birthday and the next day the staff surprised me with a cake and sang Happy Birthday. We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, in part due to the comforts of our hotel. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “administration and good performance”
Reviews.Author: mustafa i
Reviews.Content: THEHotel very clean and transparent administration and good performance, I traveled to Istanbul, the first visit I was a good administration and help me in difficult times to the site where appropriate Dr. Mustafa Jaffer issa For the period from 9-17 - January -2012

Reviews.Title: “highly satisfied, perfect place to stay, more than our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: MUHAMMAD M
Reviews.Content: i would highly recommend this hotel to all those who are looking for good location, quiet street, cleanliness , friendly staff and affordable price...... hotel was very clean , very friendly and caring staff, very tasty breakfast and incredible location. we had our baby's pushchair as well so it was a blessing to be so near to all the important sites... having free wifi in the rooms was also a big convinience as we were reading all the related histories of all the places at night wherever we went.... you wont need to take any toiletries at all as they refill everyday when they clean the room..heating system was too good as well.. as with a baby i was worried about the cold tempreture but had no problem at all. recommended food restraunts by the staff were also very good..really enjoyed the trip. :)

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: reeds_1977
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a risk and stay on the Sultanahmet side (against the recommendations of friends who suggested we stay in Beyoglu) because we wanted to be closer to the sights and in a more quiet area. We are SO glad we did. Not only was it on a quiet street (so quiet night sleeps), but Beyoglu was a mere 10 min cab ride (and about $6 CAD away!). This hotel was amazing. The staff were helpful, cheerful, attentive and warm. The breakfast was HUGE with both hot and cold items (traditional Turkish breakfasts are amazing). They have an elevator for your heavy luggage (in case you shopped as much as we did). The room was spotless, and although smaller than the standard NA room sizes, was just enough space for the two of us. AS we were leaving, the manager asked us to make sure to send him any criticisms we had so that they could improve their services - and I promise you it's hard to come up with any to share. The Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, the Hippodrome, Museums, great food and shopping are all within a 5-10 minute walk. The tram stop is 7 minutes away and takes you to Beyoglu in 15 minutes. You won't regret staying here. We loved every moment of our stay at the Sultans Royal and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidPMDublin
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Istanbul then you can't really go wrong with the Sultans Royal. Location wise it is situated in the heart of the old city and as a tourist, especially if you are on a short trip this is where you want to be, especially to avoid traffic around Istanbul.The staff are excellent, they are incredibly helpful and give great advice on places to go / eat. They can also organise tours , taxis etc and I found them really helpful and it was great to have local ( agenda free ) advice.I do have some small issues with the hotel but in general I would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to the city as the location and staff are so good

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay in cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jurate S
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Sultans Royal Hotel on December. This is a lovely, cosy, well-located brand new hotel in a quiet street within walking distance to major sights. Our rooms were clean and tidy and the breakfast was wonderful. Staff was very friendly and helpful especially Mr.Ersin who works at the front desk and let us feel so welcomed. He advised what kind of places to see, where to go, where to eat. Just ask Ersin and he will help with any issue u have.Good value - we recommend Sultans Royal Hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Melcu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the reviews are good and I didn't mistake. For me it was important to have double bed and parking for my car and everything was solved by the manager when I ask for this by mail before. The location is very very good, the staff friendly and helpfull. Only one I think it must be modified is the breakfast. The manager said that he will take care to make it a little bit different every day. I recomend and I'll stay again in this hotel on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-located hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia W
Reviews.Content: We felt welcomed from the moment we entered this lovely, small, well-located hotel in a quiet street within walking distance to major sights. The staff was warm and very helpful, and the front desk staff spoke English: they assured that our stay was comfortable and offered terrific suggestions for walks, using the tram, and other cultural events. The hotel is brand new and the rooms are very nice with good beds & linen, a tea kettle for drinks and light snacks; the bathroom was modern; and there is good closet storage. Unfortunately, the rooms are not sound-proofed; since we were on the first floor we were subject to more noise probably than usual. Still, our overall experience was very positive, and we enjoyed the included breakfast that offered both Turkish and western foods and drinks. There is a small corner store near the hotel where we made small purchases (water, snacks, tea, etc), and several good restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennyhjk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Sultans Royal from 19th Dec to 21st Dec. Our rooms were clean and the breakfast was great. Staff were also very friendly and helpful. Good value - we recommend Sultans Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Ersin the best”
Reviews.Author: Virginie A
Reviews.Content: I went in this hotel a couple of month ago with one of my friends. Ersin has been the best host ever and made our holidays fantastic. He is very friendly, devoted and helpful. I recommend to anyone going to istanbul to stop in this hotel and appreciate their fantastic employees such as ERsin. Thanks for your hard work Ersin

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: humpty d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here alone for two nights in late December. The hotel is fantastic and located in the very heart of Sultanahmet - the Blue Mosque is about five minutes by foot. The buffet breakfast is one of the best I've ever had, and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The room and bathroom were spotless and the safe in the wardrobe was very useful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Sultans Royal Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Aksy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sultans Royal hotel last mouth and we enjoyed our staying so much. This hotel is located in a magnificent place with the most of attractions which is real must to see ( Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Sultanahmet area ) Separate thanks to Ersin ( a smiling man with a brown hair ) who was very friendly and helpfull to us. We recommend this hotel for everyone who appreciates a good service and who likes to see a real beauty of Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “:)))”
Reviews.Author: Snezana S
Reviews.Content: The location was great for walking through some of the interesting parts of the city and good shopping areas. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice country Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jiaqing c
Reviews.Content: Hello.manger of hotel ,i am from shanghai china .Last month,my friends and me stayed Sultans Royal Hotel.we visited many places of Istanbul and sleeped very well in hotel during visiting.All of servers of hotel are very kind and resturant of hotel is very declisous.the location of hotel is very well thats near topkapi saray and blue mosque.I love Turkey and Turkish . BTW we were glad to get help from reception Mr Ersin,who always helped us and introduced some nice places to us, Thank u for all of help from ur hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I came and stayed here with friends last month had an amazing the staff where great.The room where so nice comfortble.”
Reviews.Author: charlotte h
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel it was amazing room so nice staff so helpful and food was lovely will go back def was fantastic!!! lovely hotel high recommed you sta here.

Reviews.Title: “The most nice hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Henriette V
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Sultans Royal for a week with my boyfriend. We use to travel quite a lot, and we found this hotel to be one of most pleasent places we've ever been staying at. Very well located, in a quiet small neighbourhood in Sultanahmet, close to the Blue Mosque. The rooms are clean and cozy, and the service includes a tasty turkish-european breakfast and the price is absolutely convenient. Also, one of the best things of staying at Sultans Royal is the very kind, friendly and professional staff. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “love istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nancy0221
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for many of the major sites and well priced. It is quite new and the rooms were very clean. Shower was great with lots of hot water. The breakfast which is included was terrific. The front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable and very pleasant to deal with. The only complaint we had was that the beds were very hard. We stayed for 4 nights and got used to the firmness, but they were somewhat uncomfortable at first. That being said, we would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay ..Great Service”
Reviews.Author: teacupmama
Reviews.Content: Sultans Royal Hotel was perfect for us. We arrived at 11:30 pm and we were an hour late getting through customs however our driver with a nice clean van was waiting for us. The pick up shuttle was included in our price for the hotel ( we booked directly through the hotel) The staff was waiting for us when we arrived aprox 1 am. We were helped with our luggage and welcomed to a lovely clean room with slippers and complimentary snacks.. I mentioned I would like to purchase fruit in the a.m. and a delicious bowl of fruit was brought to my room. Our friends asked where to purchase beer and that was brought to there room. We are U.S. travelers so this was very impressive to us. In the morning we were treated to traditional Mediterranean breakfast buffet and one of the staff members sat with us to help us with our traveling plans. This was so helpful as even though we did our usual Rick Steve's research he could not predict the snags we encountered such as the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar closing for 2 of the days were there. We were able to adjust our plans and see all that we came to see and more.. If we needed a taxi one was called but if we could walk it we were told how to get there by foot a 5 to 10 minute walk through a charming neighborhood and we were there. The hotel is small but we enjoyed its charm and attention to detail and the professional knowledgeable staff that attended to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: Sally L
Reviews.Content: What a find! This small hotel was within 5-10 minutes walk of the main sites and the rooms were spotless with hot showers and heating and comfortable beds. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we were impressed by their local knowledge of the restaurants which were great. I have already recommended it to family and friends and look forward to another visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ant Q
Reviews.Content: The Sultans Royal Hotel is in a superb location, just at walking distance to many of the most beautiful attractions of the city. The rooms were very clean and the furniture looked brand new. Also the breakfast was very good and the staff was helpful and professional. I do recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for a nice place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Valentina D
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in Sultans Royal Hotel from 16 to 22 November. We found this very nice hotel, near to the most important sites like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace, and near to the tram station that is linked to all the areas of this beautiful city. The staff is very kind and ready do satisfy every our request. The room was very clean and well cared, the breakfast was variegated and tasty. Our accomodation was excellent. If we would go back to Istanbul we surely will choose this hotel again! Valentina (Italy)

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: Gkrieger
Reviews.Content: very good location and value, room size quite fine, breakfast excellent and staff very pleasant and helpful,

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: TexasKirby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sultans Royal 2 nights in late October. The staff was very knowledgable and professional- helping us arrange 2 tours of Istanbul and then calling a cab for us to the cruise port. Questions were answered and requests honored. The location can't be beat! Short walks to all the major sites- Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapki Palace, etc. There was a vast variety of food offered in the included breakfast. We would definitely recommend this for anyone wishing to stay in the Sultanahmet (old town) of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: agnes m
Reviews.Content: Cozy new hotel, helpfull staff, good location, good value!

Reviews.Title: “it is cozy nice hotel i recommed”
Reviews.Author: mr_abood
Reviews.Content: its good and cozy i loved it..and it is ultimate placenfor peoplenwho like piece of mind and like to be away from the noise

Reviews.Title: “Super nice value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Instanbuling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and super quite I highly recommend for short or long stay the place is nice the staff are really freaindly

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean-PhilippeB
Reviews.Content: I ordered the airport transfer and got no car at the airport. Small room, the poorest mattress I ever got in a hotel, basic breakfast, for 130â‚¬ you can certainly find a better hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure.”
Reviews.Author: phc26
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when in Istanbul. The staff is super friendly, and helpful. The hotel is clean and has all you would need for visiting Istanbul. I am sure if you try it you will love it there and come back again as we plan too in spring.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linah H
Reviews.Content: This is such an awesome hotel. The location cannot be any better. The walk to all the big sights (Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, etc.) was no longer than 7-8 min. The tram station was also nearby. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were impeccably clean and tastefully decorated. And it was well-priced to boot! I really could not ask for anything more other than more time to spend there!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: doctorjane
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old daughter and I have just spent 5 nights at the Sultan's Royal Hotel. A modern, calm oasis only 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. We had a clean, spacious room with balcony overlooking the city rooftops. The manager and staff are exeptionately helpful, courteous and friendly. They went out of their way to make our daughter feel welcome. They are even sending me the item of clothing I accidentally left behind! I would highly recommend this hotel from which to enjoy the fascinating sights of Istabul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRSM
Reviews.Content: We spent the final 3 nights of our vacation at Sultans Royal and were very happy with the hotel. From our pre-arranged pick-up at the airport to the wonderful welcome we received upon our arrival at the hotel, everything went very well. We had a room on the 2nd floor facing the street and we weren't bothered by noise although we did sleep with the air-conditioning on rather than an open window. The room, while small, did have a nice comfortable bed (best we had in Turkey), 2 chairs (always nice not to have to sit on the bed only) and a clean, new washroom. Location is great - easy to walk to all the major attractions. Staff always willing to help - providing directions, recommendations, even umbrellas when it rained - and the breakfast was very good. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel as it is clean, comfortable, well-located and well-run.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: nlg54016
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5-10 min walk to Blue Mosque, Hippodrome etc. Compact but newly remodeled room and bathroom. Our room #101 is next to a street, little noisy. Staffs are all very helpful. Room lacks a wastebasket, breakfast items are limited, could use a toaster and better coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic introduction to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: UmzumbeDorset072
Reviews.Content: The reception staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean. Ask for a rear-facing room and you can probably sleep with your window open. The variety of fresh fruit on the breakfast buffet gradually reduced over my stay. Otherwise breakfast is good. The coffee is VERY strong indeed! The beds have very hard artificial pillows and the linen is polycotton, so not the most comfortable. The hotel has a superb location in the old city. I was conned twice by taxi drivers and eventually learnt to determine the price of the trip before getting into the car. Istanbul is a shabby yet beautiful and exciting city, not yet as polished as any of its other European counterparts and I hope it manages to stay that way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelliepolly
Reviews.Content: Great location for The Blue Mosque and The Grand Bazaar. Room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable with air conditioning. Breakfast was amazing, plenty of choice! The best thing about this hotel was the staff, Emlah & Serkan the reception staff, excellent english and were so helpful when it came to recommending Turkish Hamams and restaurants and places to go out in the evenings, lovely guys ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location with fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ir S
Reviews.Content: Thank you Serkan! Your help and your and gracious personality made our stay so easy. This is a fresh new hotel with everything you need to make your stay in Istanbul very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back !”
Reviews.Author: Essam A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight days in the hotel. Hotel staff are very good, attentive, friendly & very helpfull. Recommended for all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a gr8 location!”
Reviews.Author: 111_Jimbo_uk
Reviews.Content: Nice new Hotel with friendly staff. Very good location with all the main areas within walking distance. Good Breakfast but shame there isn't a bar or chill out area. We asked for tea/coffee making facilities and it was sorted out, but should have been standard in all rooms. Overall gr8 experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended--we hope to stay again when we next visit Istanbul! It's so close to the main sights that we'd often come back from sightseeing in the morning and rest during the hottest hours of the day and then go sightseeing again. Our room was impeccably clean with a lovely mural painted on the ceiling, new furnishings (king-sized bed and desk with refrigerator beneath), and newly renovated bathroom with a shower/tub combo. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the lobby was tastefully decorated with beige marble floors and an elevator next to the stairs. At registration, they presented us with iced drinks and we found a small box of lokum (Turkish delight) and two water bottles in our room the first night. To eat breakfast overlooking the sea, we asked for special permission to eat the delicious buffet breakfast in the rooftop terrace of their sister hotel, Tashkonak, a couple blocks away, and we also tried the buffet breakfast in the basement at Sultans Royal. The chefs at both hotels refresh the omelets and other hot items continually. My favorite was this roasted tomato and sausage dish, not so much for the sausage but the tomato was excellent. They had corbasi or shepherd's salad (tomato, cucumber, parsley salad with lemon and vinegar dressing), green and black olives, different types of bread, a spread of cheeses including Turkish white cheese, shortbread cookies, good coffee, and tea. Their simit (sesame bread) was a little stale, but the nearby simit shop had delicious, fresh simit for cheap (two for ~65 cents). There are small inexpensive grocery shops nearby for snacks and drinks. Also, the AC was convenient when it was especially humid. Our room's LCD TV wasn't working, but we never got around to mentioning it to the staff because we were so exhausted from sightseeing and we were happy with the free wifi. Nearby: Hagia Sophia (Aya Sofya) and the Blue Mosque, as well as Arasta Bazaar, which is less touristic with higher quality items than the Grand Bazaar or Egyptian Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “A new, fresh hotel in Sultanamet is always a treat!”
Reviews.Author: larry01970
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Istanbul and a fan of staying no where else in the city except Sultanamet, its always great to find a new, fresh experience in the old city which delivers the location, amenity and service necessary. The Sultans Royal delivers the whole package along with a great breakfast and excellent friendly service from the staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “People give this building the value it deserves”
Reviews.Author: TERA2
Reviews.Content: All things were excellent. New hotel spacious rooms super clean best area to live in instanbul what more can you ask for? Staff are all friendly young and very very helpful. Two small remarks as previously mentioned some noise for the back rooms after 8:00 in the morning and the breakfast is good but can be improved a little. O and one more thing for smokers you have to go outside but this is something i prefer although i smoke heavily. If the boss is reading keep your staff and make them happy with payments because they deserve it until the last cent!!!! Definetly stay there

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Rossonerro
Reviews.Content: I have only great things to say about this hotel: - perfect positioning, only 5 minutes away from sights: TopkapÄ± Palace, Ayasofya (Hagia Sophia), Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque, Basilica Cistern (Yerebatan SarnÄ±Ã§Ä±) and Grand Bazaar; - new hotel decorated with a combination of modern and traditional (good taste) - helpful staff - good breakfast but no diversity - quite area

Reviews.Title: “The best staff ever...we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alard M
Reviews.Content: We couldn't make a better choice! This hotel is just Fantastic. Brand new building perfectly located a few minutes walking from Sultanahmet square. It is quiet and safe, and with all the amenities you can ask for. The room has a good size, comfortable beds and extremely clean. There is a flat screen TV with lots of English channels. But the best thing for us was the staff, people who make their best for the customer: friendly, always with a smile in their faces and very helpful. The breakfast is amazing: Buffet very varied and fresh. You can not go wrong with this hotel! Highly recommended. I hope we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST HOSPITABLE RECEPTIONIST OF ALL....SERKAN”
Reviews.Author: Laurentziu34
Reviews.Content: Since we entered into the hotel we were greeted by a friendly person at the reception, this person presented us the hotel and the hotels services. Till the end the services proved to be exceptional. Starting with breakfast which was very good and finishing with sleeping time all it was a dream. Service receptionist gave us information about the places that must be visited. Room cleaning was made every day - all was shining. On the last day we had a surprise - after we visited a small partof town, and we returned to the hotel - .......the car was washed. Top marks for this hotel. 100 points. N.B. The most hospitable of all - Serkan receptionist who has a special charm. We promise to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ferat23
Reviews.Content: The most friendly staff you could ever imagine, good breakfast, new hotel and amazingly clean rooms. Central A/C was nice too, no wind blowing over your neck. We sincerely enjoyed our stay, and if we find the chance to visit the wonderful Istanbul again, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: Persian_fellow
Reviews.Content: Sultans Royal is a brand new hotel situated in the Sultanahmet area, close to all the major attractions of the city. We stayed there for 6 days, and we had such a fabulous time. The staff, they were the most amazing people we have ever met! the two front desk receptionists I got to know, Erdal and Serkan, and also the manager, they were such gentlemen, they were amazingly friendly and helpful. As we arrived we were served ice-cool welcome drinks. We were also provided with a map of the area free of charge. Also a tea maker without even asking. They did these all for free as part of their service, and for us that was what made it so beautiful. The hotel has a bellboy, so you don't need to carry your luggage, unlike some other hotels we've stayed at in Turkey. The room we stayed in for the first 3 days was ample in size and very very comfortable. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were cleaned everyday, and new sheets and towels were provided daily. also very friendly housekeeping staff. And the breakfast was fantastic, it was served in a very clean and comfortable cafe area. One word of caution, not everyone in the area knows where Mustafa Pasa Sok. is, we would advise you to arrange a shuttle with the hotel if it's your first visit. The whole experience was fantastic, We would definitely recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Sultans Royal Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Mah. Mustafa Pasa Sok.No: 29 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
